snippet.title: PT symmetric pseudo-perturbation recipe
snippet.description:
PT symmetric pseudo-perturbation recipe
by Omar Mustafa, Miloslav Znojil , 2002
"... ﻿PT symmetric pseudo-perturbation recipe Omar Mustafa Department of Physics, Eastern Mediterranean ..."
Abstract \- Add to MetaCart
The pseudo-perturbative shifted- ℓ expansion technique PSLET is shown applicable in the non-Hermitian PT- symmetric context. The construction of bound states for several PT- symmetric potentials is presented, with special attention paid to V (r) = ir 3 − α √ ir oscillators. 1 I.

snippet.title: A Case-Based Reasoning System for Recommending Cooking Recipes
snippet.description:
A Case-Based Reasoning System for Recommending Cooking Recipes
by Pedro Javier Herrera, Gonzalo Pajares, María Guijarro
"... ﻿A Case-Based Reasoning System for Recommending Cooking Recipes Pedro Javier Herrera Department ..."
Abstract \- Add to MetaCart
Case-Based Reasoning (CBR) is a successful paradigm within Artificial Intelligence (AI) of solving real-world problems based on precedent examples and problems (Aamodt & Plaza, 1994; Kolodner, 1993; Leake, 1996). Instead of relying solely on general knowledge of the problem domain, or making associations in the course of relations between descriptions of the problem and conclusions, this paradigm is capable of using specific
